intro: Hydnophytum longiflorum, commonly known as the long-flowered mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on the branches of host trees. It belongs to the family Lythraceae and is characterized by its small, green leaves and showy, white or pink flowers. The plant derives some of its nutrients from its host through specialized structures called haustoria. It is typically found in tropical and subtropical regions, often in forested areas. Its floral structure is adapted for pollination by insects, contributing to its ecological role in these ecosystems.
